e4: Changing to the new policy promotes honesty and transparency, aligning with ethical financial reporting standards. It reduces potential legal liabilities and enhances the company's reputation for integrity. Although some investors may initially misunderstand, the long-term benefits include fostering trust and confidence among all investors, ultimately supporting sustainable growth.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy and transparency, ensuring that financial data truly represents the company's performance. It should be communicated clearly to prevent misinterpretation and be free from intentional biases. The policy should consider the fairness to all investors, avoiding practices that benefit only select groups at the expense of others.
e6: Yes, I'd ask how the transition to the new policy would be communicated to all investors to mitigate misunderstandings. Additionally, I'd inquire about any steps planned to support retail investors during this change and any anticipated impacts on stock performance or investor relations strategies.
